<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#14666~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#14682~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#14863~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10524056557/job/29160036690)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10524056557/job/29160036493)

bors d+

Thanks!

bors d+

Thanks!
I think a comment might be useful here and perhaps one other place in the proof; am I right in thinking you're constructing an arbitrary simplex here, then scaling it?
Yes, that's exactly what's happening
I've now added comments throughout
Can you add the auxiliary lemma "we can intercalate a simplex between a point and one of its neighborhoods"?
I've started working on it but it's quite a lot harder because of missing API. See #14682

Nit: add
```
let normc := Finset.univ.sup' Finset.univ_nonempty (fun i â†¦ â€–c iâ€–)
```
or similar since you repeat this term four times and it's long.
super-nit: I'd argue for a `Â·` on this calc
I guess you are right, yes
This works without the `dsimp`
Is there some stronger statement along the lines of "and the points of the simplex lie on the `interior` or `frontier` of `s`"?

Because of [`interior_mem_nhds`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Basic.html#interior_mem_nhds), this lemma is easily strengthenable to `...  âˆ§ convexHull â„ (range b) âŠ† interior s`. I don't think I should be making that a lemma though as the current is syntactically more general and the stronger one is easily derived.

I don't see an easy way of making the points of the simplices lie on the frontier of `s`, eg `s = univ` has empty frontier, or `s =` a halfspace has a very flat frontier.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Intercalate a simplex between a point and a neighborhood
